status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"147ed","text":"Add freshly prepared 2% Formaldehyde (from a new vial) in PBS to a final concentration of 1%  and incubate for 10 minutes at room temperature with slow! rotation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":107,"length":15},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":122,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2dq84","text":"Add 2M glycine solution to a final concentration of 0.2M to quench the reaction and incubate 5 minutes at room temperature with slow! rotation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f9pc4","text":"Wash for 10 minutes in the cold room, on the rocker.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"70eru","text":"Split aliquot for negative control – wash again (5 minutes).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"drsov","text":"Remove supernatant and add 100µl per 1 million cells of Stain Buffer with primary antibodies. Incubate 1 hour on the rocker in the cold room.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d0t4k","text":"Wash cells 2x5 minutes in Wash Buffer and pellet with 2500xg for 3 minutes @ 4˚C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e2rd4","text":"Resuspend in DAPI Buffer and incubate for 10-15 minutes in the cold room. Wash with Resuspension Buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"14t42","text":"Resuspend the cells in Resuspension Buffer at a concentration of ~10 million cells per ml*, pass the cell suspension through a 40µm cell strainer and proceed immediately to FACS-sorting (check staining on slides to test the protocol)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvqt0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7e6i","text":"* the optimal concentration depends on the used FACS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ab4ve","text":"Sort the cells into ~20µl of cold PBS with 1% BSA. Sorting should not exceed more than 3-4 hours. Wash the sorting tubes with PBS with 1% BSA beforehand to prevent cells from sticking to the sides.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"80n8v","text":"After sorting cells can be used immediately or pelleted (5 minutes at 2500xg at 4˚C) and snap-frozen in liquid nitrogen for storage at -80˚C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4rso8","text":"Prepare a single cell solution using the Milteny Dissociation Kit. Count cells and resuspend in PBS to a concentration of 1 million cells per milliliter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: ImmunoFACS
